annotations.description: Defines how to deploy the ${NAME} server

parameters.name: NAME
parameters.description: The name assigned to all of the resources.  Use 'backup-{database name}' depending on your database provider

parameters.name: SOURCE_IMAGE_NAME
parameters.description: The name of the image to use for this resource.  Use 'backup-{database name}' depending on your database provider

parameters.name: IMAGE_NAMESPACE
parameters.description: The namespace of the OpenShift project containing the imagestream for the application.

parameters.name: TAG_NAME
parameters.description: The TAG name for this environment, e.g., dev, test, prod

parameters.name: DATABASE_SERVICE_NAME
parameters.description: Used for backward compatibility only. Not needed when using the recommended 'backup.conf' configuration.  The name of the database service.

parameters.name: DATABASE_NAME
parameters.description: Used for backward compatibility only. Not needed when using the recommended 'backup.conf' configuration.  The name of the database.

parameters.name: MONGODB_AUTHENTICATION_DATABASE
parameters.description: This is only required if you are backing up mongo database with a separate authentication database.

parameters.name: DATABASE_DEPLOYMENT_NAME
parameters.description: The name associated to the database deployment resources.  In particular, this is used to wire up the credentials associated to the database.

parameters.name: DATABASE_USER_KEY_NAME
parameters.description: The datbase user key name stored in database deployment resources specified by DATABASE_DEPLOYMENT_NAME.

parameters.name: DATABASE_PASSWORD_KEY_NAME
parameters.description: The database password key name stored in database deployment resources specified by DATABASE_DEPLOYMENT_NAME.

parameters.name: MSSQL_SA_PASSWORD
parameters.description: The database password to use for the local backup database.

parameters.name: TABLE_SCHEMA
parameters.description: The table schema for your database.  Used for Postgres backups.

parameters.name: FTP_SECRET_KEY
parameters.description: The FTP secret key is used to wire up the credentials associated to the FTP.

parameters.name: FTP_URL
parameters.description: The URL of the backup FTP server

parameters.name: FTP_USER
parameters.description: FTP user name

parameters.name: FTP_PASSWORD
parameters.description: FTP password

parameters.name: WEBHOOK_URL
parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to use for notifications.  If not specified, the webhook integration feature is disabled.

parameters.name: ENVIRONMENT_FRIENDLY_NAME
parameters.description: The human readable name of the environment.  This variable is used by the webhook integration to identify the environment in which the backup notifications originate.

parameters.name: ENVIRONMENT_NAME
parameters.description: The name or Id of the environment.  This variable is used by the webhook integration to identify the environment in which the backup notifications originate.

parameters.name: BACKUP_DIR
parameters.description: The name of the root backup directory.  The backup volume will be mounted to this directory.

parameters.name: CONFIG_FILE_NAME
parameters.description: The name of the configuration file.

parameters.name: CONFIG_MAP_NAME
parameters.description: The name of the configuration map.

parameters.name: CONFIG_MOUNT_PATH
parameters.description: The path to use to mount the config file.

parameters.name: BACKUP_VOLUME_NAME
parameters.description: The name of the persistent volume used to store the backups.  Please note, when using the recommended nfs-backup storage class the name of the pvc MUST be taken from the manually provisioned claim; nfs-backup storage MUST be provisioned manually.

parameters.name: BACKUP_VOLUME_SIZE
parameters.description: The size of the persistent volume used to store the backups, e.g. 512Mi, 1Gi, 2Gi.  Ensure this is sized correctly.  Refer to the container documentation for details.

parameters.name: BACKUP_VOLUME_CLASS
parameters.description: The class of the persistent volume used to store the backups; netapp-block-standard, netapp-file-standard, nfs-backup.  Please note, nfs-backup storage is the recommended storage type for backups.  It MUST be provisioned manually through the OCP catalog via the 'BC Gov NFS Storage' template.  nfs-backup storage CANNOT be automatically provisioned by this template.

parameters.name: VERIFICATION_VOLUME_NAME
parameters.description: The name for the verification volume, used for restoring and verifying backups.  When using the recommend nfs-backup storage class for backups, this volume MUST be either netapp-file-standard or netapp-block-standard storage; netapp-block-standard is recommended (it has far better performance).

parameters.name: VERIFICATION_VOLUME_SIZE
parameters.description: The size of the persistent volume used for restoring and verifying backups, e.g. 512Mi, 1Gi, 2Gi.  Ensure this is sized correctly.  It should be large enough to contain your largest database.

parameters.name: VERIFICATION_VOLUME_CLASS
parameters.description: The class of the persistent volume used for restoring and verifying backups; should be one of netapp-block-standard or netapp-file-standard.  netapp-block-standard performs better.

parameters.name: VERIFICATION_VOLUME_MOUNT_PATH
parameters.description: The path on which to mount the verification volume.  This is used by the database server to contain the database configuration and data files. For Mongo, please use /var/lib/mongodb/data . For MSSQL, please use /var/opt/mssql/data

parameters.name: CPU_REQUEST
parameters.description: The resources CPU request (in cores) for this build.

parameters.name: CPU_LIMIT
parameters.description: The resources CPU limit (in cores) for this build.

parameters.name: MEMORY_REQUEST
parameters.description: The resources Memory request (in Mi, Gi, etc) for this build.

parameters.name: MEMORY_LIMIT
parameters.description: The resources Memory limit (in Mi, Gi, etc) for this build.
